result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Gregory Dale Neill in court with attorney Stephen Zuber.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties stipulate to facts; joint recommendation; PSI ORDERED.  Bail continues.   Advised of rights.  Case 14CF60; 14CF61; 14CF62; 14CF63 -  Defendant pleads guilty; court finds guilty and convicts on Ct. 1;  Case 14CF59 & 14CF64 DRI.   Can argue conditions at sentencing;  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Gregory Dale Neill in court with attorney Stephen Zuber appearing by phone.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights, waives preliminary hearing.  Arraignment scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Gregory Dale Neill in court with attorney Stephen Zuber by phone.  Bruce R Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. request preliminary hearing on all matters,  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Gregory Dale Neill in court with attorney Stephen Zuber, by phone. John Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Acknowledges receipt of complaint; waives reading of complaint; advised of rights/penalties; advised of right to prelim; waives time limits for prelim - reserves right; bond set.
